thread.title: Venus Williams rallies to advance to 2nd round in Hong Kong
thread.title_full: Venus Williams rallies to advance to 2nd round in Hong Kong

title: Venus Williams rallies to advance to 2nd round in Hong Kong
text:
Updated: 8:58 a.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 | Posted: 8:58 a.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 Venus Williams rallies to advance to 2nd round in Hong Kong Related Venus Williams of the United States prepares to return a shot against Yuliya Beygelzimer of Ukraine at the WTA Hong Kong Open Tennis tournament in Hong Kong Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015. (AP Photo/Kin Cheung) Sponsored Links The Associated Press HONG KONG â€” 
Venus Williams rallied to beat Yuliya Beygelzimer of Ukraine 2-6, 6-4, 6-4 Tuesday in the opening round of the Hong Kong Open. 
The third-seeded Williams wore a bandage on her left thigh and looked hampered in her movements. However, she came from a break down three times in the final set to close out the win in 2 hours, 13 minutes. 
After leveling for 4-4 in the decider, she held her serve for the first time in the set to take a 5-4 lead before breaking again to secure the win. 
Former No. 1 Jelena Jankovic also advanced with a 6-4, 6-2 victory over Romanian qualifier Ana Bogdan. 
Two other seeded players, No. 5 Samantha Stosur of Australia and No. 7 Caroline Garcia of France also earned straight-set victories. 
Stosur defeated Japan's Risa Ozaki 6-3, 6-1 while Garcia brushed aside American Lauren Davis 6-1, 6-3. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
